text: In addition, a significant reduction in the percentage of outpatient consultations for ILI was detected during 2010-2011 in North China (Figure 3 ). During the 2009 pandemic, the highest weekly ILI rate was 12.1 cases per 100 consultations in week 44 of 2009 ( Figure 3 ). The ILI rate was relatively stable, based on data available from the weekly ILI surveillance system of North China in 2010. The percentage of patient visits for ILI peaked at 5.0% in late January 2011.
